title: Is there an Arial Extended?
content:
Is there an Arial Extended?   
   
Thank you
author: jonathanlawley

comments.content:
Nope. There's [Helvetica Extended](http://web.archive.org/web/20140802053753/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/neue-helvetica/helvetica-53-extended/) or [Berthold Akzidenz-](http://web.archive.org/web/20140802053753/http:/www.philsfonts.com/showing.html?sku=BQ900380X1P1&start=1)   
 [Grotesk Extended](http://web.archive.org/web/20140802053753/http:/www.philsfonts.com/showing.html?sku=BQ900380X1P1&start=1), but no Arial Extended. I once suggested   
it to David Saunders way back in 1993 who was then with   
the Monotype Drawing Office (before the merger with Agfa).   
I literally told him "Why not make an extended version of   
Arial? The world can use some more extended faces."   
That was shortly after I had found out there were only very   
few "wide" faces in the FontBook.   
   
They didn't follow the advice of a one-year-in novice at   
FontShop Belgium, can you imagine that?! ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140802053753im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/bigsmile.gif)   
   
Nonono, I'm not pulling yer leg, this is a true story, I kid you   
not. This is _SO_ funny you bring this up after all those years.
